subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Hermes: The Greek God of Thieves
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hermes: The Greek God of Thieves usable.

hook.text: On the day he was born, Hermes stole Apollo's cattle. Hours old and already a thief. The gods loved him for it.

buildup.text: Hermes invented the lyre from a tortoise shell and gave it to Apollo as a peace offering. Charm plus cunning.

discovery.text: He became the messenger god, guiding souls to the underworld and protecting travelers, merchants, and thieves.

twist.text: Hermes is the only Greek god who moves between all worlds: Olympus, Earth, and Hades. Tricksters cross boundaries.

climax.text: Hermes shows that tricksters aren't outcasts. They're essential connectors between worlds that need a go-between.

punchline.text: Born a thief, became a messenger of gods. Hermes connects all worlds.

quiz.question: What makes Hermes unique among Greek gods?
options: He moves between all worlds: Olympus, Earth, and Hades
